intro: Eriocoelum racemosum, commonly known as the racemose eriocoelum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit and produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically has simple, alternate leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecology.
